faqs.question: How much does septic maintenance cost in Granbury?
faqs.answer: Annual plans range from $200 to $400 per year. Conventional systems at the lower end, aerobic units with quarterly visits at the higher end. All plans include inspections and documentation. Call (936) 292-2926 for options.

faqs.question: Do lake homes in Granbury need extra maintenance?
faqs.answer: We recommend it. Lakeside proximity increases environmental stakes, and seasonal use patterns stress systems differently than steady occupancy. Semi-annual visits for conventional systems and quarterly for ATUs provide good protection for Granbury lake properties.

faqs.question: How does maintenance protect Lake Granbury?
faqs.answer: Maintained systems produce properly treated effluent that poses minimal risk to groundwater and the lake. Unmaintained systems can release contaminants that travel through sandy loam to the lake quickly. Regular service is every homeowner's contribution to protecting this community resource.
